intro: Licania cidii, commonly known as the Amazonian evergreen tree, is a species native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its dense, glossy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments with high rainfall. Its bark contains compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Licania cidii plays an important ecological role in supporting biodiversity within its native habitat.
